content: Changed order of the words in the validators, so that they can be slightly more different from the test cases.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: good addition to medium puzzles

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: ...the problem of placing letters is interesting, and not something I've seen before in the CodinGame problems. It is nontrivial to consider the different letter locations, and to print out the letters in a grid when needed.

I like the puzzle, but feel it would fit better as Medium.

A brute force solution works: looping over valid intersections of H1&V1, H1&V2, H2&V1, then checking the constraints about forming a square and ensuring separation. It's always fun to write rendering code to print the solution, but that's not as hard as the optimizations I'd expect from a Hard puzzle.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Yes i'll aprove it but in the section of Hard problems i would like too see Graph Theory, Dynamic Programming and others not only simple stuff like this(it is not simple but.... still it is too simple for Hard) :)

Hello.

The puzzle is now up for validation.
Looking forward to your comments. I'll try to answer all your questions as well as possible.

Vincent

Hello Humanosaure
By symmetry, you get a second solution. Which one should we pick?
example:
SEA
U.R
NOT
could also be
SUN
E.O
ART

Hi, I have a few suggestions. 

I think puzzle is quite interesting, but limitting it to 4 words is not really necessary. Also counting all the solutions seems to be excessive, would be better to have any valid solution.

Basically what I'm suggesting, give a list of words in the input, without dividing them into H and V, and let people print out any valid solution or "IMPOSSIBLE" in case there is none.

This way it would definetly fit into hard or even very hard section, based on the test cases.

Hi everyone.

I'm thinking about submitting this puzzle. I'm still working on the validators and cleaning up the solution. I'm looking for feedback before submitting it for validation.

Is the goal clear ? Any help for better English really welcome. Any ideas for the tags ? Any other suggestion ?

The brute force solution I've coded is certainly not the most elegant one, but it seems to be thorough. I'm curious to see how others will deal with the problem.

It is certainly not an easy puzzle but I'm not quite sure if it should be Medium, Hard or Very Hard, so I set it to Hard while waiting for your comments.

Thanks in advance.

Vincent
What do you mean by "let people print out any valid solution"? How do you test that with the platform constraints?

Merci ;) 

It is specified that the 2 first words are horizontal and the 2 other ones are vertical.
Thank you.

Sure. I changed it to Medium.

I think so far 2 comments are in favor of Medium and one comment is in favor of Hard.

Thanks for your detailed feedback, CarlWalsh.
Thank you.
Thank you.
it is indeed!

It is quite possible, basically you need to check if output is valid in terms of this particular problem, you dont even need a solver inside the referee. Just checking if all the words are presented, if they crossed and not neighboured would be enough i think
What referee are you talking about? I think it's a multiplayer thing which doesn't apply to puzzles.
Oh, i didn't realised in/out puzzles don't have a referee. Though about solo puzzles, for solo puzzles it would be relevant, otherwise you right.

Hi, wlesavo.

I thought about it and, as Uljahn said, it will not be possible to accept any valid solution.

As for adding more words, well, it is already pretty hard to find funny examples with four somehow "related" words that all cross.

Maybe your are thinking about a different game altogether.

I think it is quite challenging as it is but I'll see no objection to publishing it in the medium section if the wisdom of crowds recommends so.
No, i now think it is ok in the form it already is, it would actually require different approach to make what i was thinking about. Also after solving it i think hard is the correct category.

Thank you for taking the time to solve it.
I hope you enjoyed.

Vincent.

Hi, wlesavo.

As you already solved the game, if you enjoyed it, would you feel like approving it for publication ? (Time is kind of running short and that was quite a lot of work ;) ). Thanks in advance if you read this.
